title_full: MIGREL01-BP01 Define SLAs across all applications or environments (like production, development, or test) and confirm them with your business team
title: Define SLAs across all applications or environments and confirm them with your business team
description: Existing applications have current service levels which must be maintained during migration. Evaluate the unique aspects of your applications to understand if you have different availability requirements for each application. Define goals for each application based on availability.
outcome: SLAs defined for all applications and environments with business team confirmation.

title_full: MIGREL01-BP02 Define and automate runbooks and communicate them to your teams
title: Define and automate runbooks and communicate them to your teams
description: Prepare, document and validate procedures for your workload to minimize the disruption of your workload during events. It is recommended to automate runbook procedures so runbook activities are performed consistently.
outcome: Automated runbooks prepared, documented, validated, and communicated to teams.

title_full: MIGREL01-BP03 Map AWS Global Infrastructure to your business SLAs before migrations starts
title: Map AWS Global Infrastructure to your business SLAs before migration starts
description: Understand AWS Global Infrastructure terminology and definitions. Identify the services you plan to use when you migrate and compare the AWS Service Level Agreements to your existing business SLAs. Your existing SLAs may need to be updated based on AWS Service Level Agreements.
outcome: AWS Global Infrastructure mapped to business SLAs with necessary SLA updates identified.

title_full: MIGREL01-BP04 Select tools to monitor SLAs and notify you in case thresholds are exceeded
title: Select tools to monitor SLAs and notify you in case thresholds are exceeded
description: Select and configure monitoring tools to track SLAs and provide notifications when thresholds are exceeded. Use managed services to reduce operational overhead and save licensing costs. Monitor networking links during migration.
outcome: Monitoring tools selected and configured for SLA tracking with notifications and migration-specific monitoring in place.

title_full: MIGREL02-BP01 Keep your business impact analysis up-to-date
title: Keep your business impact analysis up-to-date
description: Check that your portfolio and CMDB data is correct. Keeping application metadata up-to-date is challenging. The application metadata should be verified so the correct BCP is put in place as part of the migration project.
outcome: Business impact analysis verified and updated with current application metadata.

title_full: MIGREL02-BP02 Update the risk assessment for the type of disaster events covered by your BCP
title: Update the risk assessment for the type of disaster events covered by your BCP
description: Add new events for your cloud environment. Various events in the cloud environment (complete loss of AWS Region, complete loss of an AWS Availability Zone, or service degradation of a single AWS service) need a risk assessment.
outcome: Risk assessment updated to include cloud-specific disaster scenarios.

title_full: MIGREL02-BP03 Define the recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO) targets
title: Define the recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO) targets
description: Create a small number of different RPO and RTO classes. Migrations can have hundreds of applications in scope, and creating many different RPO or RTO targets which map to different disaster recovery strategies can increase the complexity of migration.
outcome: RPO and RTO targets defined using a limited number of classes to manage complexity.

title_full: MIGREL02-BP04 Select a disaster recovery strategy based on cloud best practices
title: Select a disaster recovery strategy based on cloud best practices
description: Select a disaster recovery option which meets your RPO and RTO targets and addresses risks defined in your BCP. Automate disaster recovery options to be implemented as migrations occur.
outcome: Disaster recovery strategy selected based on cloud best practices with automation for implementation during migration.

title_full: MIGREL03-BP01 Estimate the required maintenance window
title: Estimate the required maintenance window
description: Migration to AWS could involve a brief or extended outage of service during the cutover from the current environment. The amount of data in the final synchronization, combined with the speed of network links, determines the outage period required for the migration.
outcome: Maintenance window estimated based on data volume, network speed, and migration method with appropriate stakeholder communication.

title_full: MIGREL03-BP02 Test the migration window and impact
title: Test the migration window and impact
description: Dry-run the migration activities to validate that they can be completed in the defined maintenance window. Perform dry-run tests in environments with similar data volume or anticipate the additional volume of data that the production environment has.
outcome: Migration window validated through dry-run testing with contingency plans for extended maintenance periods.

title_full: MIGREL03-BP03 Plan for failure
title: Plan for failure
description: Calculate and document the time required to rollback. Define a communication channel for the migration event. Determine how data can be copied back to the source environment for failback scenarios.
outcome: Rollback procedures documented with communication channels established and failback capabilities defined.

title_full: MIGREL04-BP01 Be aware of service quotas and constraints for migration services
title: Be aware of service quotas and constraints for migration services
description: Review service quotas for AWS Application Migration Service and AWS DMS, as these can affect the sizing of your migration waves and number of operations which can be performed simultaneously.
outcome: Service quotas for migration services reviewed and considered in migration planning.

title_full: MIGREL04-BP02 Estimate the impact of new workloads on existing service quotas across accounts and Regions
title: Estimate the impact of new workloads on existing service quotas across accounts and Regions
description: Review service quota values that would breach if new migration workloads are added to an account. Request limit increases for such quotas before your migration events.
outcome: Service quota impacts assessed with limit increases requested before migration events.

title_full: MIGREL04-BP03 Be aware of unchangeable service quotas and how you determine which accounts or VPCs workloads use
title: Be aware of unchangeable service quotas and determine which accounts or VPCs workloads use
description: Depending on the migration scope, you may have to split workloads into multiple AWS accounts or VPCs to avoid hitting unchangeable service quotas.
outcome: Unchangeable service quotas identified with workload distribution strategy across accounts or VPCs as needed.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP01 Provide sufficient bandwidth for normal and traffic from data replication
title: Provide sufficient bandwidth for normal traffic and data replication
description: Replication traffic may need to be throttled so it does not overwhelm network links. Ensure sufficient bandwidth is available for both normal operations and migration replication traffic.
outcome: Sufficient bandwidth provisioned with throttling configured to prevent overwhelming network links.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP02 Assure that links and equipment to on-premises are highly available
title: Assure that links and equipment to on-premises are highly available
description: If network connectivity is disrupted, migration replication may need to be restarted. Use multiple AWS Direct Connect connections or VPN tunnels between separately deployed private networks.
outcome: Highly available network connectivity established with redundant Direct Connect connections or VPN tunnels.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP03 Verify that your network design enables communication between on-premises and cloud networks
title: Verify that your network design enables communication between on-premises and cloud networks
description: Design networks to prevent overlapping IP addresses with your on-premises network. Not all networks need to be routable to on-premises.
outcome: Network design validated with non-overlapping IP addresses and appropriate routing configuration.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP04 Use an IP scheme that allows for sufficient growth within cloud workloads and burst auto-scaling
title: Use an IP scheme that allows for sufficient growth within cloud workloads and burst auto-scaling
description: Amazon VPC IP address ranges must be large enough to accommodate workload requirements, including factoring in future expansion and allocation of IP addresses to subnets across Availability Zones.
outcome: IP addressing scheme designed to accommodate growth and auto-scaling requirements.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP05 Complete a reliable DNS design that enables resolutions to existing domains, plus new domains in AWS
title: Complete a reliable DNS design that enables resolutions to existing domains and new domains in AWS
description: DNS resolution between multiple AWS Accounts and on-premises is fundamental for application communication. Plan for how to update DNS records during migration testing and cutovers.
outcome: DNS design completed supporting hybrid resolution between on-premises and AWS with update processes defined.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP06 Test network performance prior to migration
title: Test network performance prior to migration
description: Network latency has varying effects on applications. Testing how migrated applications respond to the new networking environment can be performed using distributed load testing and monitoring performance metrics.
outcome: Network performance tested and validated before migration using distributed load testing.

title_full: MIGREL05-BP07 Test network component failure
title: Test network component failure
description: Network outages have varying effects on applications. Testing how applications respond to connectivity events can be performed using AWS Fault Injection Service.
outcome: Network failure scenarios tested using AWS Fault Injection Service to validate application resilience.

title_full: MIGREL06-BP01 Identify and back up all data that needs to be backed up, or reproduce the data from sources
title: Identify and back up all data that needs to be backed up, or reproduce the data from sources
description: Validate that your backup process implementation meets your recovery time objectives (RTO) and recovery point objectives (RPO) by performing a recovery test both before and after the migration.
outcome: Backup processes validated to meet RTO and RPO requirements with recovery testing performed.

title_full: MIGREL07-BP01 Deploy the workload to multiple locations
title: Deploy the workload to multiple locations
description: Follow the best practices in the Reliability pillar to distribute workload data and resources across multiple Availability Zones or, where necessary, across AWS Regions. Always deploy your workload components to multiple AZs for high availability.
outcome: Workloads deployed to multiple locations with high availability architecture across Availability Zones.

title_full: MIGREL08-BP01 Before the cut-over, test HA and FT for the migrated workloads, and perform a DR dry-run after the migration
title: Test HA and FT for migrated workloads before cut-over, and perform DR dry-run after migration
description: Test to validate that your workload meets functional and non-functional requirements before and after migration cutover. Follow the best practices in the reliability pillar to complete the failure management testing for the migrated workloads.
outcome: High availability, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery capabilities tested and validated before and after migration.
